David doesn't want to play your game, maybe, i can bug Him a bit but, I  
d=
on't think He wants to play this game anymore. sf
 
 
In a message dated 7/=
16/2010 3:42:38 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
rasterer@... writes:

 =

 
 
I am  hesitant to reveal the answer to anyone before  the end of the t=
est, 
since that would call into question a possible  'leak'.  

But I have=
 loaded a mac version of the file up  now, which doesn't use any 
self-extr=
acting extra applications: just the  disk imaging built into the 
OS.  I'll=
 look into doing the same with  Windows, so there is no worry about 
any ap=
ps in the zip  file.



--- On Fri, 7/16/10, David Koenig  <floridajakeblue=
s@floridaja> wrote:


From:  David Koenig <floridajakeblues@floridaja>
Subj=
ect: Re:  [EVP-ITC] Experiment 2
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsTo: 
Date:  Friday,=
 July 16, 2010, 12:15 PM


 
This is AWESOME!!!! 
We did several experiment=
s like this on the Magic Cafe and the  results 
were amazing. However, I wo=
uld request that you contact one  member on the 
board and tell them the re=
al answer. If the zip file  carries any applications 
it can not be trusted=
 unfortunately.
I think this can be very exciting and fun too!!!!
Dave
THE =
MAN THE SKEPTICS REFUSED TO TEST FOR A MILLION  DOLLARS.

On Fri, Jul 16, 2=
010 at 2:28 PM, rasterer <_rasterer@yahoo.  com_ 
(mip://0bf5ca68/mc/compos=
e?to=3Drasterer@...) > wrote:


 
 
 
Experiment 2

On Friday, 7/16/2=
010 I placed an object on  top of my computer monitor, 
right in front of m=
e, and will leave it  there until noon Denver time on 
Monday, 7/19/2010. T=
his experiment  asks for participants to determine what that 
object is. Va=
gue or  partial answers won't be counted (for example, just 
giving a color=
,  shape, size, what it's made of, etc): we're looking for what it 
is.  An=
swers anyone reveals after noon Monday won't count. Participants  
can use =
their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or any other means they  chose. At 
the e=
nd of the experiment, I will reveal the object, and a  tally of the 
number=
 of correct and/or incorrect answers.

In  order to keep me honest, I have =
taken a picture of the object at the  
start of the experiment and loaded i=
t to the Files section (RJ  folder) of 
this group. The idea with this file=
 is that you can  download it now and 'keep 
it safe' on your computer. The=
n at the end  of the experiment, I will post 
the password so you can revea=
l the  contents of the file. That way, you were 
in control of the original=
  image during the entire test, not me. If you 
can follow the link, it  is=
 here:

Windows users: _http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/  EVP-ITC/file=
s/ 
RJ/RJ20100716. win.zip_ 
(http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/fi=
les/RJ/RJ20100716.win.zip) 

Mac users: _http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/gro=
up/  EVP-ITC/files/ 
RJ/RJ20100716. mac.zip_ 
(http://tech.groups.yahoo.com=
/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100716.mac.zip) 

And if you do not  care to do=
wnload the zip file now, I will post the final 
image there  at the end of =
the experiment anyway.

My monitor is one of the  older box-like SONY CRTs,=
 and says "Trinitron" 
and "Multiscan 200sf"  on the upper front. I have a =
couple monitors stacked in 
my closet  too: they are not the monitors used =
in this experiment (and have 
 nothing else on them anyway), and I have sev=
eral laptops around:  they are 
also not the monitors in this experiment. T=
he monitor in  this experiment 
is the only SONY monitor I have, says "SONY=
 in  various places on it, can be 
seen in the following link from the  fir=
st experiment, when the correct 
answer would have been  "radio":

_http://=
tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/  EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ.20100710. 
1.JPG_ (htt=
p://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ.20100710.1.JPG) 

Pleas=
e post all  answers to the group thread: that way, there will be a 
public =
record  and I won't get accused of losing any answers. 

And best of  luck =
to all the participants!
